Pleasant Hill is also accessible by car from highway 680 with exits at Contra Costa Boulevard, Monument Boulevard, and Willow Pass Road (technically in Concord but the closest exit to northern Pleasant Hill).
The Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) stops at the Pleasant Hill station.
Small aircraft can land at Buchanan Field Airport in nearby Concord but most people coming to Pleasant Hill by air use the larger Oakland Airport and then drive in or take BART the rest of the way.
Although biking and walking is certainly an option, it is advisable to have access to a car while staying in Pleasant Hill. Bus service (County Connection) is also available.

Taxi service is available, but on a much reduced scale as compared to major cities. Occasionally you might be able to hail a cab at the Bart Station and in the downtown area but don't expect it; it is always better to call and arrange for a taxi to pick you up.

. This trail is built along the canal system and passes through Pleasant Hill, Walnut Creek, and Concord. It connects Concord's Lime Ridge with Pleasant Hill's Las Juntas Park and Walnut Creek's Larkey Park and Heather Farm. Pedestrians, bicyclists, and equestrians are allowed on the trail.

content=Although this area is often frequented by middle and high schoolers, Downtown Pleasant Hill offers many delightful activities both during the day and at night. Century 16 Movie Theaters is located downtown, which shows all of the biggest movies that are released. There are many shops and restaurants.
,  nicknamed the Dome because of its roof that is shaped as a dome, plays current movies and has a very nostalgic feel to it. Usually cheaper than the corporate theaters around.

Downtown Pleasant Hill offers a variety of restaurants, ranging from Chipotle to Redbrick Pizza to the more upscale French restaurant Left Bank.
Restaurants available outside the downtown area include:

value: content=Offers casual Italian meals.  The pizza and pasta are traditional, yet delicious.
content=A tiny barbecue joint that maintains a bit of old California character.  The food is reasonably priced and more than edible, and the bar serves decent drinks.
content=A small hot dog joint which is well-known to locals. Besides made-to-order hot dogs, good thick milkshakes are served.
content=Great family place for pizza and pasta.
content=A small but good hamburger place.
content=Contra Costa Blvd. Best donuts ever.
content=Known for its great breakfast that's known as being one of the best around, cash only though

content=Known for having some of the best sandwiches around, part of the local Kinder's franchise that is local here in the bay area only at the moment. Try the ball tip sandwich best sandwich they have

. Irish style bar recently remodeled, has 21 hd tv's, pool, darts and shuffleboard. They have a DJ every friday and saturday night, has decent parking

value: content=In downtown Pleasant Hill, The Suites are located in Contra Costa County, just minutes from Walnut Creek and Concord and 30 miles east of San Francisco.
- Concord is one of the largest cities in the East Bay and has a variety of shopping and dining options.
- Downtown Walnut Creek is perhaps Contra Costa County's best option for restaurants and bars.  Shopaholics will also be more than satisfied with the variety of downtown boutiques.
